text:
How does MS-Office 2019 compare to MS-Office 2007?
2007 was last version I used a lot, and it was a big step up in slickness from 2003. I think I used 2010 once and it was not much improved from 2007.

These days I am all markdown or Google Docs.
But just curious

text:
> What even is a local office suite for?
Sensitive or personal docs often require a local office suite unless you're willing to host Collabora or the likes yourself. It's not straightforward to turn a markdown file into a letter with proper layout unfortunately (pandoc can probably do it anyway).

Sharing or storing those files privately is relatively easy, even if it's not quite live-collaboration

text: I use office every day at work, and it's hard to remember what it used to be like 10 years ago but it's definitely improving. Best thing is probably OneDrive integration at this point which allows Google docs like live collaboration  from within the desktop app (there's also office online but the features are more restricted in the browser). They also moved to rolling releases with subscription a few years ago so you now get some rando new features quite frequently
